title: Massive Ping Spikes and DCs in the first two minutes of every match - but only there. Very weird.
body:
This is really a weird problem. In the loading screen my ping is shown jumping in a range between 200-2500 ms.

Several ping spikes and short dcs happen then in the first two minutes of the game. The rest of the match is playable with no disruptions and a smooth 29 ms ping.

Tbh I have absolutely no clue what is causing this. Firewall is adjusted to the game, every other online application works just fine... can't think of anything. My personal fear is that it suddenly starts going beyond the two minute mark and loses me a game for it. So... any clue what this could be any how to fix it?

replies.body: Thanks for the update!  You can use our HRT to configure your firewall settings, but I'm not sure it can do much else in this case.  It may be best to post your logs individually to our tech team to help through a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  You can grab the logs from the HRT and attach it to the ticket.  We'll respond asap!
Will do once this ranked is over. Thanks for the reply.

It certainly sounds like your network is getting bogged down somehow, and it can be due to various reasons like strength, settings, or even how your ISP is routing to the game server.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader)  for the matches this is happening in to find out what's going wrong.  The results should provide details on your specific issue, as well as troubleshooting steps to fix it up.  Let me know what you come up with!

It only told me "welp you got issues, bro". However, as I am somewhat familiar with the topic the offered solutions are usually only working if there are constant issues.

However, as I did another game I could observe it again: there are no lags or pingspikes after the 2 minute mark. ONLY before it. So this isse might be a bit more weird/complex.

I can post the log here if you think that would help. Meanwhile I consider using the Hextech Repair Tool...
